stories.text:
Hey.

Long story short, I think something went wrong in my LinkedIn profile was temporarily restricted ( I don't think I did anything unusual, but who knows what happened ). MS wants me to submit my ID, which I won't do for several different reasons, but it is not why I am here. I am seeing it as an opportunity. Yeah, that profile was substantial and so on, but why can't I recreate it as my own space/website? It is mostly there to for HR/recruiters anyway..

I guess the question is. How do you guys do it ( show off your online presence )? Simple website? Blog? Github?

Thank you in advance,
stories.title: Ask HN: Personal LinkedIn Replacement?
Responsive web pages: Design happens between breakpoints

stories.text:
Hi HN,

For the last couple of months a few distinct parties have gained access into my home network. They're also tracking sound through landlines in my house. It's a really long story but the gist of it is that I got into some back-and-forth on social media, and then things kind of erupted.

They have remote access into multiple Macs on my network, they're key logging devices, and have backdoor access into many web accounts (Google, Facebook, Twitter to name a few). I don't think I can do anything about the last one, but I'm hoping for assistance in getting them out of my network. They've referenced private data from those services (like Google Photos, YouTube history, Discord conversations, etc) and have referenced conversations I'm having in my home. They're running intricate botnets and have been controlling my feeds on Twitter, Mastodon, Facebook, YouTube, and maybe more.

I've contacted a lawyer, but they were unable to help. I'm fairly sure they don't want anything other than to annoy me, so at this point I'm not particularly keen on taking legal action, but I'm hoping for sophisticated resources, contacts, or anecdotes for getting them out of my network.

Thanks.
stories.title: Ask HN: Rat in My Network

stories.text:
Imagine we have any flagman smartphone but can not access GPS/GloNaS, GSM/CDMA and if we have an Internet connection we can't make any assumptions about IP.

We may turn a camera as needed, also we have compass, accelerometer, gyroscope and maybe an analog zoom.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it possible to get a location using a camera looking at Moon/Sun?
